column1: Today is #SmallBusinessSaturday! Our Southern Illinois small businesses have been hit hard by the COVID-19 shutdowns and need our support now more than ever. #ShopSmall https://t.co/St9g4as6Eh

REMINDER: The @USDA is still accepting applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program 2 for farmers impacted by COVID-19. The application deadline is next month – DECEMBER 11 2020. Visit https://t.co/XbdeVJUS7o for more info.

Since COVID-19 has limited our opportunities to gather together this Veterans Day we’ve created a space for folks to share memories videos photos & thank yous for So. IL vets. Visit https://t.co/V5y9shAUXE to participate – we'll share some of the submissions Wednesday! (2/2)

Wrapped up our Southern Illinois Agriculture Tour in Scheller at John Kabat’s farm to discuss the impact of COVID-19 on the pork industry and increasing local food markets. Thanks to all of the farmers and producers who met with us this week! https://t.co/2nH4PMOpK7
I visited with Tom Miller from Marion on Tuesday as part of my Southern Illinois Agriculture Tour. We talked about assistance for livestock producers impacted by COVID-19. https://t.co/XnWngGkmgO

Small businesses are the backbone of our Southern Illinois economy. I’m honored to receive the @NFIB’s Guardian of Small Business Award and will keep fighting to ensure our small businesses get the help they need to recover from the COVID-19 shutdown. #smallbizguardian https://t.co/AyxekJUQm7

This morning I hosted a Women in Agriculture call with several of our Southern Illinois female industry stakeholders. We discussed the USDA’s Coronavirus Food Assistance Program ethanol and trade and they gave me an update on how harvest is going. https://t.co/O8CVN5hS6C
It’s always great to catch up with the folks at the @bellevillenewsd. This morning I spoke with @kelseylandis about recovering from COVID-19. https://t.co/8yDsX64sK7

COVID-19 UPDATE: Happy to report that all of the staff I’ve interacted w/closely in recent days has tested negative for COVID-19. Everyone on the team is feeling good & is symptom free. Tracy & I are continuing our recovery at home & should be good to go once our quarantine ends.

Wanted to reach out and thank everyone for the thousands of well wishes and prayers I have received since announcing my COVID-19 diagnosis last week. Here’s a quick update on how Tracy and I are doing. https://t.co/7zoMhsZQRf

This funding will be used to help ensure that folks who are out of work because of the COVID-19 shutdown have the skills needed to pursue careers in scientific fields. Perhaps the next scientific breakthrough will come from right here in the Metro East! (2/2)

So. IL steelworkers & manufacturers have long known the importance of producing goods here at home. COVID-19 has only made that more apparent. We must end our dependence on China & ensure meds PPE & technology are made in America! #CommitmentToAmerica  https://t.co/sU9qSAe3N4 https://t.co/MgqSzVj9Mq

.@HouseGOP has a plan to provide relief to small businesses crippled by COVID-19. The Speaker refuses to allow a vote. We're taking matters into our own hands w/ a discharge petition. This forces a vote whether Pelosi wants it or not; but we need 218 signatures. #FightForSmallBiz https://t.co/xAGL0L8o2P
House Republicans made a #CommitmentToAmerica to defeat COVID-19 keep Americans healthy and restore our way of life.  Read more about our plan at https://t.co/sU9qSAe3N4 https://t.co/ftru1Qko3K

I’m in DC this week for votes & committee hearings. Today I started my day with Tony St. James from @AllAgAllDay. We talked all things agriculture – from the @EPA's RFS announcement to @USDA’s Coronavirus Food Assistance Program the Phase 1 China trade deal & USMCA. https://t.co/iMwCbvEElv

As a former truck driver myself I thank the Southern Illinois truckers who’ve worked around the clock to ensure stores are stocked during COVID-19. I introduced the Truck Parking Safety Improvement Act to ensure they have safe places to park & rest when on the road. #NTDAW (1/2) https://t.co/9KopkeM55r

Today @USDA announced the 2nd round of the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) designed to assist farmers impacted by COVID-19. Sign-ups begin on Monday September 21 and run through December 11. Visit https://t.co/XbdeVJUS7o for more info & the application. https://t.co/J4JS2LzVEl

Great meeting with @biofuelresearch’s John Caupert from Waterloo and folks with @GrowthEnergy today as part of their #BiofuelsSummit! We discussed the EPA’s recent RFS announcement the importance of trade and the impacts of COVID-19 on our biofuels industry. https://t.co/alGjWxKmvZ

With the Murphysboro Apple Festival postponed b/c of COVID-19 I wanted to share a #tbt from the 1957 festival. It was taken from the 2nd floor of the old Crawshaw’s Funeral Home & if you look closely you can see my mom & Milton! Mom was 8 months pregnant w/ Debbie at the time! https://t.co/ocd39keBwg

Throughout COVID-19 many families have struggled to keep up with monthly rent payments. @HUDgov has awarded over $3.2 million in CARES Act funding to St. Clair and Madison counties to help prevent families from being evicted during these tough times.   https://t.co/KaQUX3fHbU

When she was forced to close day to day operations because of the COVID-19 shutdown Leah Maciell & her team started raising funds & donating hundreds of meals to folks in need. I was honored to recognize her for her dedication to our community. #IL12HometownHeroes (2/2) https://t.co/eMeKFOh4pZ

Our next Hometown Heroes are the folks at the Collinsville Food Pantry. Throughout COVID-19 they’ve been working to make sure families are fed & I was honored to recognize them for their efforts. Thank you for your dedication to our Metro East community! #IL12HometownHeroes https://t.co/uGWyvfzvct

Pleased to share that 5 Southern Illinois health centers have received @HHSGov grants to combat the spread of COVID-19. These grants will provide them with critical resources to keep communities safe and healthy.  More from @kfvsnews ⬇️  https://t.co/DUXeaA9p5q

Every year millions of tons of cargo is transported along Southern IL rivers highways & rail. The COVID-19 shutdown hasn’t slowed them down & it hasn’t stopped the work I’m doing in these areas either. Here’s some of the work I’ve done recently as a member of @TransportGOP. https://t.co/NIa4NY8Llg

Birthdays have looked a little different b/c of COVID-19. But that didn’t stop Hometown Hero Angie Judd-Greco from Edwardsville! She organized a group of 800 volunteers to attend birthday parades for kids in Madison Co. Thanks for bringing joy to So. IL kids! #IL12HometownHeroes https://t.co/maxRlredFj

Today’s Hometown Hero spotlight is on the Franklin County Farm Bureau! They've been donating hand sanitizer to local police & delivering lunches to folks in need during COVID-19. Thanks to Gay Bowlin & the team at the Franklin County Farm Bureau for your work! #IL12HometownHeroes https://t.co/C1JalEmQbI

Today's Hometown Hero is Dear Diva Desserts in Columbia. During the COVID-19 shutdown Bethany & Zac provided free breakfast to folks in need no questions asked. Honored to present them with a certificate of recognition for their dedication to our community. #IL12HometownHeroes https://t.co/U2BOW8XtmF

I’ve consistently supported additional funding for USPS including during COVID-19.   If the Speaker truly supports funding USPS then let’s see if she puts forward a bill that provides the appropriate funding w/o partisan poison pills to score points w/her far left base. (2/3)

Our doctors & medical professionals have been working around the clock on the COVID-19 front lines to care for their patients. This week I spoke with @SIHealthcare's president & CEO Rex Budde to get an update on the work SIH is doing to help keep our communities safe & healthy. https://t.co/tpbw262pU8

Yesterday I visited General Cable in Du Quoin to discuss how they’ve grown their business over the past few years as well as how they are keeping employees safe during COVID-19. Some of the cable they produce at their facility is being used in the southern border wall. https://t.co/EXJKizzb6w

After restaurants closed b/c of the COVID-19 shutdown they have donated & delivered 14000 boxes of produce per week to local food pantries & families in need. Rex Tony & Lance thanks for all you're doing to feed our community during a tough time! #IL12HometownHeroes (2/2)

Today we kicked off our Hometown Heroes tour recognizing Southern Illinoisans who have gone above & beyond to help their communities during the COVID-19 recovery. This morning I spoke with the trio behind Cusumano & Sons: Rex Tony & Lance Cusumano from Mt. Vernon. (1/2) https://t.co/D5re1jPc8E

Southern Illinoisans have gone above & beyond to keep our communities safe & healthy during the COVID-19 shutdown & they're working just as hard to get our economy back on its feet. This month I’ll be recognizing some of our Hometown Heroes for their contributions – stay tuned! https://t.co/uB0U9qlI30

Congress sent Illinois $3 billion in federal COVID-19 assistance & Gov. Pritzker continues to ask for more. Yet he has withheld 86% of those funds from being disbursed & refuses to disclose how local govts can access funding. Irresponsible & unacceptable. https://t.co/RR5eTyc89y

The COVID-19 shutdown has strained the resources of our rural communities. I introduced a bill to expand access to emergency funding so these communities can continue providing necessary emergency services & establish additional COVID-19 testing centers.   https://t.co/IR6ixJ4P6V

I've personally contacted state & federal authorities to get to the bottom of this.    The COVID-19 shutdown has had a crushing impact on our economy & working families. We need to help the folks who need it. But we need common sense oversight in how funds are distributed. (2/2)

Southern Illinoisans are making the best of a tough situation - from making masks to organizing socially distant birthday parades to feeding families in need. More from @thesouthern on how folks are coming together to support their communities.⬇️  https://t.co/cCuO0ZZw3Z

From docs on the front line to folks making masks & providing food to families in need So. Illinoisans have stepped up to keep our communities safe & healthy during COVID-19.  Do you know someone who has gone above & beyond to help? Let me know here! → https://t.co/rR3iDswdzC https://t.co/U8KJJcswkG

It's hard for many vets to travel to VA facilities for a disability exam & COVID-19 has only made it more complicated. I introduced a bill to allow specialized care providers to conduct appointments across state lines so vets can get an exam close to home. https://t.co/sXuz0j7U2D

Southern IL veterans: @VAVetBenefits Under Secretary for Benefits Paul Lawrence is hosting a telephone town hall TODAY at 4:00pm central time to discuss COVID-19 the Blue Water Navy Act & the Solid Start program. Veterans interested in participating can call in at 844-227-7557.

While safety is our top priority we're witnessing a shutdown gone too far. The Grand American trapshooting competition is a time-honored event in So. IL. Banning this year’s event shows a lack of appreciation for how COVID-19 impacts regions differently. https://t.co/Xbmhi7PQXF

The Republican members of @HouseVetAffairs Subcommittee on Disability Assistance & Memorial Affairs showed that we can balance safety with duty. We took precautions socially distanced & held an in-person forum on serving vets during COVID-19. We will always show up for our vets! https://t.co/8NtzptVWX6

Important info for Southern Illinois farmers: @USDA is now accepting applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program. This program will provide direct relief to farmers & producers impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. More info & the application ↓ https://t.co/pXbNowcHq4

Folks in the Metro East – make sure you look out for a flyover from the  932nd Airlift Wing tomorrow! The flight departs from @ScottAFB & will fly over the Metro East to salute health care workers & first responders fighting COVID-19 on the front lines.   https://t.co/2kjQMVdhXu

Illinois received federal COVID-19 funding nearly a month ago yet many communities outside of Chicago have not received funding. I joined my Illinois Republican Congressional colleagues in asking Governor Pritzker for more information on how these funds are being allocated. https://t.co/4mlnRzjtEi

Proud to launch Farm Corps to provide job opportunities for unemployed IL veterans by pairing them w/ farmers who have a shortage of on-the-farm labor b/c of COVID-19. Thanks to @ILFarmBureau Farmer Veteran Coalition of IL & @AgrAbilityIL for their work!  https://t.co/fvvQrq9zfs

Today @USDA announced the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program to provide $16 billion in direct payments to farmers & producers. Our farmers work every day so we have food for our tables. Thank you @POTUS & @SecretarySonny for giving them much-needed relief https://t.co/q3wUaNFqlP

Thank you to everyone who participated in our COVID-19 telephone town hall last night! We covered a wide range of issues including the Phase 4 COVID-19 bill Governor Pritzker’s reopening plan and China. https://t.co/BUG0Mfdqn1

Gov. Pritzker recently said he is considering withholding federal COVID-19 funds from local governments if they allow small businesses to reopen ahead of his timeline. My IL GOP House colleagues & I sent a letter urging Congressional leadership to act so this does not happen. https://t.co/177soGardW

Coronavirus relief is not a Democrat or Republican issue. Instead of working together Speaker Pelosi chose to push forward a liberal wish list of wasteful spending incentives for illegal immigration and extreme changes to election law.   https://t.co/zHPOdurvC4

Throughout the COVID-19 pandemic truckers have been working to make sure stores are fully stocked. While not perfect @USDOT’s new Hours of Service rule is an improvement & allows them to better determine when & where to take rest breaks instead of a one-size fits all approach.

On my way to DC to vote against Speaker Pelosi’s phase 4 COVID-19 bill tomorrow. Instead of working across the aisle the Speaker is pushing a 1800 page bill drafted w/ zero input from any Republicans. Families & businesses are hurting; now is not the time for political games. https://t.co/vdGmD8pcti

I’m hosting a telephone town hall on Thursday to discuss coronavirus response and relief efforts reopening Illinois and the need for Congress to get back to work in DC.   📞 Thursday at 12:10 PM ❓ What questions do you have? 📋 Sign up to participate at https://t.co/FDJJB0k8zI https://t.co/skHdzFVdVL

ICYMI: @HHSGov has awarded 5 Southern Illinois health centers funding to expand COVID-19 testing. Testing is critical to determining the scale of outbreaks in our communities which is why I've supported Congressional efforts to expand and improve testing. https://t.co/u1f7ksRDvC

While in-person classes have been canceled because of COVID-19 teachers are still working hard to educate their students. To all of our Southern Illinois teachers thank you! #TeacherAppreciationDay https://t.co/QhpTpNqBbK

Important info for Southern Illinois farmers and agricultural producers: @SBAgov is now accepting COVID-19 Economic Injury Disaster Loan and Advance applications on a limited basis. Make sure you submit yours ASAP. https://t.co/RnRHzly2OL

As we continue working to stop the spread of COVID-19 the last thing folks should have to worry about is whether they'll be safe from the virus in their own homes. @HUDgov has awarded 15 Southern IL housing authorities grants to help keep residents safe. https://t.co/UuhExwwtbP

As we work to ensure the health & safety of Southern Illinoisans it’s clear that COVID-19 is impacting communities across IL in different ways. Governor Pritzker should create a safe regional & data-driven plan to reopen IL that takes both health & economic needs into account. https://t.co/lKzX3v74vK

.@USDOT awarded over $8 million to @MAAirport & Veterans Airport of So. IL through the CARES Act & Airport Improvement Program. These funds will help sustain these airports during the COVID-19 pandemic & support jobs for So. Illinoisans working there.  https://t.co/gcz71tu87z

Thanks to @POTUS @realDonaldTrump & many in Congress the federal government has taken significant action to protect families & combat COVID-19 in Illinois. Check out my website to see the actions taken & the aid provided by the federal government. https://t.co/LkwtbjUA5f

This afternoon I participated in a conference call with the Illinois Hospital Association Senator Durbin Senator Duckworth Rep. Shimkus and hospital leaders across Southern Illinois to discuss hospital readiness and the federal response to COVID-19. https://t.co/VfEavFeQp8

Speaker Pelosi is pushing to create a Select Committee on the Coronavirus Crisis. She wants more bureaucracy more partisan grandstanding and another means to attack the president.  The federal government already has eight oversight functions over the COVID-19 response:

Thank you to our Southern Illinois truck drivers equipment operators flight crews maintenance workers emergency personnel and other essential employees who keep America moving. Your hard work has not gone unnoticed. #COVID19 #ToThoseWhoKeepUsMoving https://t.co/63EI9hkPCA

Yesterday 100000 medical face masks arrived in Illinois from @MOFA_Taiwan. As a member of the Congressional Taiwan Caucus I'm grateful for Taiwan's generosity as we work to stop the spread of COVID-19. @tecochicago

The FCC is accepting applications for the COVID-19 Telehealth Program. Health care providers can apply for funding to cover the costs of telecommunication & information services & devices so they can provide patients with care through telehealth services. https://t.co/mLcoNqgBAY
The @IDPH has a new free coronavirus mental health hotline. Folks can text “TALK” to 552-020 to be connected with a mental health professional.  https://t.co/8xiJVRc8qG
The @USDA has a helpful guide for coronavirus resources available for rural communities. More info ↓   https://t.co/Qbhmn5MRMm

Thank you to everyone who participated in our COVID-19 telephone town hall this afternoon including our special guest Dr. Josh Miksanek from SIH Herrin Hospital. We covered a lot of ground on COVID-19 including questions about social distancing testing and the #CARESAct. https://t.co/DxIJIBbKNn

Over $6.2 million in federal grants are headed to 5 Southern IL health centers to help combat the spread of COVID-19. These grants which are funded through the #CARESAct will provide much-needed resources to medical professionals on the front lines. https://t.co/tS0ExgRVF0 https://t.co/xifWb7jSHv

If you’re a small business owner & have questions about the coronavirus relief options available to you please check out my website. We’ve created a one stop shop with info about the Paycheck Protection Program Economic Injury Disaster Loans & more.   https://t.co/RqhnBAf2wo https://t.co/bAxChi4RFh

Our local restaurants coffee shops and bars are struggling because of coronavirus. Many are continuing to serve their customers in any way they can including delivery and carry out services. Let's show them our support by suggesting your favorite local eatery! https://t.co/OgOkYio20M

I’m hosting a telephone town hall on Thursday with Dr. Miksanek from SIH Herrin Hospital to discuss COVID-19 health implications & response & relief efforts in Congress.  📞 Thursday at 12:30PM ❓ What questions do you have? 📋 Sign up to participate at https://t.co/FDJJB0k8zI https://t.co/5wfD6OX5wa

Have questions about the different coronavirus relief options available to you and your small business? @HSBCgop has a guide to help you determine which program is best for you.   https://t.co/wgQQdlXKVZ

I hosted a telephone town hall this morning with over 260 Southern Illinois small businesses to discuss the #CARESAct & coronavirus economic relief. Thank you to all who joined us & our expert guests from the @ILChamber the Illinois Small Business Development Center & @HSBCgop. https://t.co/fEazINqoRa

Wanted to give you a quick update on coronavirus in our district including some positive news about grants our two hardest hit counties St. Clair and Madison have received from the #CARESAct to help fight this illness.   More info on the grants: https://t.co/y2uYDWkIpM https://t.co/zWu3pUbJUX

With so much uncertainty and concern surrounding COVID-19 it seems like good news has become harder to find. Well actor @johnkrasinski has started the @somegoodnews broadcast from his home to remind us of many of the silver linings in the world today. https://t.co/0OHfuljPDI

To the Southern Illinois doctors on the front lines fighting against coronavirus – thank you.  We are grateful for all you do to keep your patients and our communities safe and healthy. #NationalDoctorsDay https://t.co/96SuK9EvGO

I’m sad to share that St. Clair County is reporting a second COVID-19 related death. The patient was in her 30s – a reminder that no one is immune to this devastating illness. Please join Tracy and me in keeping her family in your prayers. https://t.co/hiNfhGT6aw

Sad news from St Clair Co as IL-12 has its 1st reported COVID-19 death. This tragic loss confirms why it was critical Congress acted swiftly on the #CARESAct. Lives are being lost & we had an obligation to act. Tracy & I send our prayers to the family during this difficult time. https://t.co/ZPuoQUeeMZ
I’m here in Washington preparing for a vote on the coronavirus relief bill. Let’s get it done. https://t.co/iI3WyGvz1I
Took a 6am flight back to DC this morning with @RodneyDavis to help pass the coronavirus relief bill. https://t.co/HsWV1Ny1y5

Earlier today I joined my Illinois House colleagues in supporting Illinois’ request for a major disaster declaration. Thank you @POTUS for quickly approving the request. This will allow Illinois to apply for individual & public assistance through @FEMA as we fight COVID-19. https://t.co/fp86pkxgyG

Since our Congressional Art Competition awards reception was canceled because of COVID-19 concerns I wanted to share the winning submission from @BEaLancer201's Thomas Jackson with you. His artwork shows how Southern Illinois is truly “More Than Just Corn.” Congrats Thomas! https://t.co/3ccCS1QdZx

Unfortunately due to COVID-19 we had to cancel this year's Congressional Art Competition awards reception. However I wanted to announce this year's winner – make sure you watch until the end! Thanks to our judges the folks at @SWICedu & the students who participated this year! https://t.co/oxGcWg1rju

Across the US folks are stepping up to help in the fight against COVID-19. In Southern IL @biofuelresearch & Stumpy's Spirits Distillery are producing hand sanitizer. Southern Illinoisans know that we are stronger when we work together. #InItTogether ⬇️ https://t.co/iVQriaqnu5 https://t.co/kZkBRWDnch

We all play an important role in stopping the spread of COVID-19 – whether you’re a doctor grocer restaurant owner or even a brewer. Anheuser-Busch is producing and distributing hand sanitizer around the U.S.  https://t.co/HQtZFNIOHc

First responders risk their lives to keep us safe & many don't have the personal protective equipment needed to protect themselves against COVID-19. I urged House leaders to include grants for firefighters & first responders for PPE to prevent infection in the next COVID-19 bill. https://t.co/WYD00G0jap
Important COVID-19 information for service members and their families stationed at @ScottAFB → https://t.co/b7mn7AUxqj

The @FHFA is working to help folks whose ability to pay their mortgages has been impacted by COVID-19. If your loan is owned by @FannieMae or @FreddieMac you may be eligible to delay payments w/o late fees or fear of foreclosure. More information ↓ https://t.co/LYUjLUkrDm
🚨Important info from the @FTC about how to protect yourself from coronavirus scammers. 🚨https://t.co/7P8FfG3pYs

Many of our small businesses have had to temporarily close their doors or adapt their services in order to keep our communities safe from COVID-19. These shops restaurants and bars employ our families neighbors and friends.

Over 45% of our nation’s vets are 60 years or older – the age group that's most at risk of contracting a serious case of COVID-19. My @HouseVetAffairs & @VetAffairsDems colleagues & I are working w/ @DeptVetAffairs to identify their readiness & keep vets & their loved ones safe. https://t.co/J0UvrCrTAO

In order to do our part to limit the spread of coronavirus many of my meetings have turned into conference calls. Today I’m talking with local hospital administrators to get a status report from our healthcare professionals on the ground and update them on the federal response. https://t.co/GshPfNhkTm

The state of Illinois has launched a website with up-to-date information about our state's efforts to combat coronavirus. It includes important resources for prevention as well as information for businesses hospitals and schools. → https://t.co/BrXXgj1v4u

.@SIHealthcare has a 24-hour hotline for folks who believe they may have been exposed to coronavirus. Anyone in IL can call – even if SIH isn’t your normal healthcare provider. Visit their website for more information or give them a call at 844-988-7800. https://t.co/PywOE680jq

We must all do our part to slow the spread of coronavirus. Please visit https://t.co/32LaH0hQG0 to stay updated on the latest guidance and suggestions from the @WhiteHouse and @CDCgov. https://t.co/HNfbM6Ji7S
A good read from @TheHill about how social distancing will help #FlattenTheCurve and limit the spread of coronavirus. ↓ https://t.co/yPVqsJEiFH
Southern Illinois veterans: To learn more about the steps the VA is taking to protect veterans from coronavirus please visit their website ↓ https://t.co/Tiy37ziosi

Important info for St. Clair & Madison Cos: As a precaution against the spread of coronavirus local officials limited events to fewer than 50 people for the next 8 weeks. Please continue to follow CDC recommendations to keep yourself & loved ones healthy. https://t.co/GGD9PGcjsF

In the early hours of the morning Republicans & Democrats put the health & safety of Americans above politics & came together to increase access to coronavirus test kits & ease the burden on families & job creators as we continue to fight this pandemic. https://t.co/RUn3dKQ1L9

This afternoon I spoke with the emergency management coordinators for our Southern Illinois counties to update them on efforts in Congress to stem the spread of coronavirus talk about preparations on the ground in IL12 and offer any assistance I can from the federal level. https://t.co/GAwnUpaADR

Tonight President Trump laid out a decisive plan to fight the spread of coronavirus and help families and businesses impacted by this illness. We must work together to keep Americans safe and healthy. https://t.co/yl22PIovVy
Helpful info from the White House Coronavirus Task Force on ways you can help keep businesses schools and homes safe from the spread of coronavirus ↓ https://t.co/omaZRKPfng

Older adults and those with serious chronic medical conditions like heart lung or kidney disease are at higher risk of contracting coronavirus. Here is some helpful information from the CDC on how to protect yourself and your loved ones. https://t.co/RKpA3Q2fmU

How can my bill the VA COST SAVINGS Enhancements Act help the VA limit the spread of coronavirus? The answer lies among the used needles bandages and surgeons’ gloves at the bottom of a medical waste container. https://t.co/wyLBGsLJkf

It’s critical we do all we can to prepare for and prevent a major novel coronavirus outbreak in the U.S. Both @POTUS and Congress have made this our top priority. We voted today to give the CDC and state and local agencies the tools they need. https://t.co/kpwMXmfOWo https://t.co/YKFjHHYhsj

Carbondale’s Illinois Department of Public Health Lab is one of three labs in Illinois designated as a state testing location for the novel coronavirus. More from @thesouthern about the testing process ↓ https://t.co/dlpUVawOzh

As the number of cases of the novel coronavirus in the U.S. increase the best defense is to be informed and prepared. Make sure you visit my website for up-to-date information from @CDCgov. ↓   https://t.co/dGyAaDeE9l

It’s critically important that we act quickly to prevent the spread of coronavirus and keep Americans safe which is why @POTUS and @VP have announced a White House Coronavirus Task Force and Congress is looking to fast track funding to combat and research the virus.

The @bellevillenewsd is reporting that a patient at Belleville Memorial Hospital is being screened for coronavirus. Not a confirmation or affirmative diagnosis but I am monitoring the situation closely. https://t.co/NSpj2IkPRS
